course.subject: LANG
course.name: Chinese for Non-Chinese Language Background Students II
course.description: This course builds on the groundwork laid in LANG 1120, and takes students to a higher level of understanding of Putonghua phonology and a stronger communicative competence in using Chinese in daily and social situations. The course is restricted to students with non‐Chinese language backgrounds. Instructors’ approval is required for students with Chinese backgrounds who are from international schools of Hong Kong, China Mainland and other Asian countries, also for overseas students with either Mandarin or Cantonese language backgrounds. For students without prerequisite but with prior Chinese learning experience of approximately 50 hours may seek instructors’ approval to enroll in the course.
course.exclusions: HKDSE/HKALE/HKCEE/JEE Chinese, LANG 1113, LANG 1114 (prior to 2017-18), LANG 1115 (prior to 2017-18), LANG 1116 (prior to 2017-18), LANG 1117, LANG 1118

reviews.author: LIFEGOOD
reviews.title: Quite hard as a beginner
reviews.comment_content:
Quite hard as a beginner.

I did Chinese back in grade 9 and i forgot everything

I dont even have LANG 1120 background. So i felt it was quite hard.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her teaching is amazing.

If i can understand, it means she is really good at teaching.
She is very enthusiastic at teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not a bad grading.
I thought i fucked up my grammar test. but received an A overall which was a big surprise.

Had 3 verbal presentation about 4 minutes. She really pay attention to your pronunciation but as a foreigner, this you cannot improve in a short time.
But i got an A, so won't complain.
reviews.comment_workload: Dictation almost every week and quite alot of exams.

reviews.author: chickenhkust
reviews.title: Not a satisfactory course
reviews.comment_content: Basic Chinese language. This course will roughly cover 10 chapters and the contents are not that difficult. Actually, things depend on the instructor.
reviews.comment_teaching: I personally hate her teaching style. It doesn't even feel like teaching. Moreover, her English is sometimes quite disturbing although it's not a big deal. Overall, for me, her lecture was mundane and deprived of interest.
reviews.comment_grading: This course is very exam oriented. There are three assessments and the points are a bit crazy. There is a big discrepancy between the contents she taught and the difficulty of the exam. You gotta take this course if your Chinese level is high enough and just faking to take lower level class. Don't take this course if you are not confident enough with your Chinese. Just take LANG 1120. This is for the beginners and it will better suit you.
reviews.comment_workload: There's not much work to do. Just prepare for the assessments if you, indeed, got to take this course.

reviews.author: Shouheng
reviews.comment_content:
10 lessons in total
Follows the structure of the textbook: Chinese for Non-Chinese Language Background Students III (if you are unsure of the level of difficulty, go take a look at the textbook at the book store)
For example:
making personal comments;
talking about personal feelings;
talking about past experiences;
talking about future plans;
talking about various abilities;
asking and giving advice; and
asking and giving directions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Small (around 20 students) and interactive class so you will not find it boring
The teacher is very willing to help you if you have questions
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment one (Lesson 1-4): Pronunciation 10% Listening 10% Oral 10%
Assessment two (Lesson5-7): Pronunciation 10% Listening 10% Oral 10%
Assessment three (lesson 1-10): Oral 10% Character 10% Grammar 10% Letter 10%

You could find the gradings for oral assessment a bit strict especially with your pronunciation and fluency.

Keep in mind: "In line with general University guidelines, the Center for Language Education’s official minimum attendance requirement for LANG courses is 80% (inclusive of the Add/Drop period). If you miss 20% of classes or more, you will fail the course."
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost all the workload comes from preparing for the assessments
In addition, there are optional character studies homework to help you prepare for the character assessment in the assessment three
